data.name: CRM
data.description: Stores and manages customer data, including personal details, sales pipeline, and service interactions.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates an authorized user to gain access to the CRM.
threats.mitigation: Implement strong user authentication mechanisms, such as Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and Single Sign-On (SSO). Regularly review user access rights.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker modifies customer data within the CRM, such as altering sales records or customer information.
threats.mitigation: Use data integrity checks, digital signatures, and role-based access control (RBAC) to prevent unauthorized data changes. Implement logging and alerting for any unauthorized data modification attempts.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A user denies having performed a particular action within the CRM, such as modifying customer records.
threats.mitigation: Enable logging and auditing within Salesforce to track user actions. Use non-repudiation techniques such as maintaining secure, immutable logs to provide proof of actions.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive customer data (e.g., PII, purchase history, preferences) is disclosed to unauthorized users.
threats.mitigation: Ensure data encryption both at rest and in transit. Enforce least privilege access, meaning only authorized users can access sensitive information. Monitor data access with alerts for unusual activity.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker could overload the CRM system, causing it to become unresponsive or unavailable.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, request throttling, and ensure Salesforceâ€™s cloud infrastructure has DoS protection measures. Utilize cloud-based distributed denial of service (DDoS) protection services.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker or unauthorized user exploits a vulnerability to gain higher-level privileges in the CRM system.
threats.mitigation: Use RBAC to ensure users have only the permissions required for their roles. Regularly conduct security assessments and patch management to mitigate vulnerabilities.

data.name:
Third-Party
 Scheduling
 System
data.description: Used for managing service appointments, vehicle deliveries, and maintenance scheduling.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a legitimate user to gain access to the scheduling system.
threats.mitigation: Implement MFA and secure authentication protocols for all users. Regularly audit access controls to prevent unauthorized access.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker modifies appointment or vehicle delivery data in the scheduling system.
threats.mitigation: Enforce data integrity checks, use digital signatures, and employ RBAC to prevent unauthorized data modification. Log and monitor all system changes.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A user denies having scheduled or modified appointments.
threats.mitigation: Maintain secure, immutable logs of all actions taken in the scheduling system to provide proof of actions and enable audits.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive scheduling information is disclosed to unauthorized individuals.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data at rest and in transit, and enforce strict access controls. Monitor data access with alerts for any suspicious activity.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker overloads the scheduling system, making it unavailable for legitimate users.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting and request throttling. Ensure the third-party provider has robust DDoS protection measures in place.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker exploits a vulnerability to gain higher-level access within the scheduling system.
threats.mitigation: Implement RBAC to restrict access to administrative functions. Conduct regular security assessments and patch any vulnerabilities promptly.

data.name: Cloud Storage
data.description: Stores customer data that has been migrated from on-premise servers for scalability and accessibility.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates an authorized user to gain access to cloud storage.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strong user authentication mechanisms, including Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) and Single Sign-On (SSO). Regularly audit access control policies.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker modifies stored data, such as customer information or service records.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption, data integrity checks, and version control to protect stored data. Implement logging to detect unauthorized modifications.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A user denies having made changes or accessed cloud-stored data.
threats.mitigation: Maintain secure, immutable logs of all activities and actions taken in cloud storage. Implement non-repudiation measures to track user activities.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive customer data stored in the cloud is disclosed to unauthorized individuals.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data both at rest and in transit. Enforce strict access controls with least privilege principles. Use monitoring tools to detect unusual access patterns.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker floods the cloud service, making data inaccessible to legitimate users.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, request throttling, and ensure the cloud provider has DDoS protection in place.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

data.name:
departments 
devices
data.description: Laptops, desktops, and tablets used by service staff to access Salesforce, scheduling systems, and loyalty program data.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a legitimate user by gaining access to service department devices.
threats.mitigation: Implement strong user authentication mechanisms, including password protection and Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). Enforce policies for secure device use.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker gains physical access to a device and modifies stored data or software.
threats.mitigation: Use full-disk encryption to protect stored data, enforce secure boot settings, and implement endpoint security software to detect unauthorized changes.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A user denies actions taken on a service department device, such as accessing or modifying customer data.
threats.mitigation: Enable logging and auditing on service department devices. Use tamper-evident logs to provide proof of actions taken.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive information accessed through service department devices is exposed to unauthorized individuals.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt data stored locally on devices and ensure that network connections are secured with VPNs. Train staff on proper handling of sensitive data.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker physically damages or disables a device, rendering it unusable.
threats.mitigation: Implement device tracking, ensure regular backups of critical data, and have replacement devices readily available.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker exploits vulnerabilities in the device or its software to gain elevated privileges.
threats.mitigation: Keep devices and software up to date with security patches. Use RBAC to limit the privileges of users and enforce least privilege principles.

data.name:
Network 
Infrastructure
data.description: Internal network that connects service staff devices to the cloud-based CRM, scheduling systems, and loyalty program.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a legitimate device or user within the network.
threats.mitigation: Implement Network Access Control (NAC) to authenticate devices, use strong authentication protocols, and employ encryption for communication.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker modifies data packets in transit across the network.
threats.mitigation: Use encryption protocols like TLS to protect data in transit. Implement integrity checks and secure routing mechanisms to prevent tampering.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A network user denies having performed certain actions, such as accessing resources or modifying network configurations.
threats.mitigation: Enable logging of all network activities, including access and configuration changes. Use tamper-evident logs and secure storage for audit trails.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive data transmitted over the network is intercepted by an unauthorized party.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt all sensitive data in transit using secure protocols (e.g., TLS/IPsec). Implement network segmentation to reduce the risk of data interception.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker floods the network with excessive traffic, making it unavailable to legitimate users.
threats.mitigation: Deploy firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems (IDS/IPS), and rate limiting to mitigate DoS attacks. Utilize cloud-based DDoS protection services.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker gains elevated privileges within the network by exploiting vulnerabilities.
threats.mitigation: Use RBAC to limit user privileges. Regularly update network devices with security patches and conduct vulnerability assessments to address potential weaknesses.

data.name:
Email and
Messaging
System
data.description: Used by sales and service staff to communicate with customers regarding appointments, loyalty rewards, and follow-up services.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a legitimate user to gain access to email or messaging systems.
threats.mitigation: Implement MFA for email and messaging access. Use email authentication protocols such as SPF, DKIM, and DMARC to prevent spoofing.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker modifies the content of emails or messages in transit.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt emails and messages in transit using secure protocols like TLS. Use digital signatures to verify the integrity of messages.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A user denies having sent or received a particular email or message.
threats.mitigation: Use digital signatures and maintain secure, tamper-proof logs of all communication activities.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive information shared via email or messaging is exposed to unauthorized parties.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt emails and messages both at rest and in transit. Implement access controls to restrict who can view or send sensitive information.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker floods the email or messaging systems, making them unavailable to legitimate users.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, spam filtering, and ensure that the email service provider has anti-DDoS measures in place.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker exploits vulnerabilities in the email or messaging system to gain elevated privileges.
threats.mitigation: Use RBAC to limit user privileges. Regularly update and patch email and messaging systems to address vulnerabilities.

data.name:
Loyalty 
Program 
Management
data.description: Manages customer loyalty rewards, service credits, milestones, and ownerâ€™s club benefits.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker impersonates a legitimate customer to gain access to loyalty rewards or manipulate referral credits.
threats.mitigation: Enforce MFA for customer accounts and use CAPTCHA to prevent automated attacks. Regularly monitor login attempts for unusual activity.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker modifies loyalty program data, such as rewards balance or referral information.
threats.mitigation: Use data integrity checks, implement encryption for stored data, and utilize role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict modification rights.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: A user denies performing actions related to loyalty program participation, such as redeeming rewards or referring others.
threats.mitigation: Maintain secure, tamper-proof logs of all loyalty program transactions. Use digital signatures to verify actions taken.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Sensitive customer data, including service history and loyalty rewards, is disclosed to unauthorized parties.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt sensitive data both at rest and in transit. Implement access controls to ensure only authorized users can view or modify customer data.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker overloads the loyalty program system, making it unavailable to legitimate customers and staff.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting, request throttling, and ensure the loyalty program service provider has anti-DDoS measures in place.

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: An attacker exploits vulnerabilities to gain elevated privileges in the loyalty program system.
threats.mitigation: Use RBAC to limit user privileges and enforce the principle of least privilege. Regularly conduct security assessments and apply patches promptly.

data.name: Data Flow
data.description: Data such as service history and customer interactions flows to/from the Loyalty Program Management System to maintain consistency.

data.name: Data Flow
data.description: Customer and sales data is stored in Cloud Storage for accessibility and scalability.

data.name: Data Flow
data.description: Customer service requests (appointments, vehicle deliveries) are sent to the Scheduling System. Updates to appointments are synchronized back to Salesforce.

data.name: Data Flow
data.description: Service staff use devices to view and update appointments via the scheduling system.

data.name: Data Flow
data.description: Cloud-stored data is accessed for customer management and reporting purposes.

data.name: Data Flow
data.description: Any interaction relevant to rewards or loyalty points is also logged into the Loyalty Program System.
